A

addUser(String) - Method in class main.ClackServer
Adds a user to the userList

B

broadcast(ClackData) - Method in class main.ClackServer
Takes in ClackData object 'dataToBroadcastToClients’, and does not return anything
broadcastTo(ClackData) - Method in class main.ClackServer
Takes in ClackData object 'dataToBroadcastToClients’ and int 'clientPort', and does not return anything

C

ClackClient - Class in main
The ClackClient class contains the following variables: userName - String representing name of the client hostName - String representing name of the computer representing the server port - Integer representing port number on server connected to closeConnection - boolean representing whether connection is closed or not dataToSendToServer - ClackData object representing data sent to server dataToReceiveFromServer - ClackData object representing data received from the server inFromStd - Scanner object representing standard input inFromServer - ObjectInputStream to receive information from server outToServer - ObjectOutputStream to send information to server
ClackClient(String, String, int) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
Constructor for username, host name, and port, connection should be set to be open
Should set dataToSendToServer and dataToReceiveFromServer as null
ClackClient(String, String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
Constructor to set up port to default port number 7000
ClackClient(String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
Constructor that sets host name to be localhost
ClackClient() - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
Default constructor that sets anonymous user
ClackData - Class in data
The abstract class ClackData contains the following variables: username - String representing name of client user type - An integer, refer to section labeled About the type variable date - Date object representing date when ClackData object was created
ClackData(String, int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Constructor to set up userName and type, date should be created automatically here
ClackData(int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Constructor to create anonymous user, whose name should be Anon
ClackData() - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Default constructor, sets type to "CONSTANT_LISTUSERS"
ClackServer - Class in main
The ClackServer class contains the following variables: port - Integer representing port number on server connected to closeConnection - boolean representing whether connection is closed or not serverSideClientIOList - an ArrayList consisting of ServerSideClientIO objects
ClackServer(int) - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
Constructor that sets port number
Should set dataToReceiveFromClient and dataToSendToClient as null
ClackServer() - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
Default constructor that sets port to default port number 7000
ClientSideServerListener - Class in main
The ClientSideServerListener class contains the following variables: client - ClackClient instance variable representing a client that calls this class to make a threaded Runnable object.
CONSTANT_LISTUSERS - Static variable in class data.ClackData
 
CONSTANT_LOGOUT - Static variable in class data.ClackData
 
CONSTANT_SENDFILE - Static variable in class data.ClackData
 
CONSTANT_SENDMESSAGE - Static variable in class data.ClackData
 

D

data - package data
 
date - Variable in class data.ClackData
 
decrypt(String, String) - Method in class data.ClackData
This method decrypts the encrypted string and returns it

E

encrypt(String, String) - Method in class data.ClackData
Protected method that encrypts a string using the Vignère Cypher then returns it
equals(Object) - Method in class data.FileClackData
 
equals(Object) - Method in class data.MessageClackData
 
equals(Object) - Method in class main.ClackClient
 
equals(Object) - Method in class main.ClackServer
 

F

FileClackData - Class in data
The class MessageClackData is a subclass of ClackData and contains the following variables: fileName - String representing name of file fileContents - String representing contents of file
FileClackData(String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.FileClackData
Constructor to set up username, fileName, and type
FileClackData() - Constructor for class data.FileClackData
Default constructor

G

getCloseConnection() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Returns the close connection variable
getData() - Method in class data.ClackData
Abstract method to return the data contained in this class (contents of instant message or contents of a file)
getData(String) - Method in class data.ClackData
Abstract method to return the data contained in this class (contents of instant message or contents of a file)
getData() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Implemented here to return file contents
getData(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
overloaded here to return decrypted file contents
getData() - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Implemented here to return instant message
getData(String) - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Overloaded here to return a decrypted message
getData() - Method in class main.ServerSideClientIO
Helper function for getting the data to one user in broadcastTo()
getDate() - Method in class data.ClackData
Returns the date
getFileName() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Returns the file name
getHostName() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Returns the hostname
getPort() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Returns the port
getPort() - Method in class main.ClackServer
Returns the port
getType() - Method in class data.ClackData
Return the type
getUserList() - Method in class main.ClackServer
Returns the list of users as a string
getUserName() - Method in class data.ClackData
Return the username
getUserName() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Returns the username

M

main - package main
 
main(String[]) - Static method in class main.ClackClient
Initializes a ClackClient object and connects to a server
main(String[]) - Static method in class main.ClackServer
Initializes a ClackServer object and connects to a client
MessageClackData - Class in data
The class MessageClackData is a subclass of ClackData and contains the following variables: message - String representing instant message
MessageClackData(String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
Constructor to set up username, message, and type
MessageClackData() - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
Default constructor
MessageClackData(String, String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
Constructor to set up username, an encrypted message and type

P

printData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Prints the received data to standard output

R

readClientData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Reads the data from the client, does not return anything
readFileContents() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Performs a non-secure file read
Reads in the data from the file called fileName and writes it to the instance variable fileContents
readFileContents(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Performs a secure file read
Reads in the data from the file called fileName, encrypts it, and writes it to the instance variable fileContents
receiveData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Receives data from the server, does not return anything
receiveData() - Method in class main.ServerSideClientIO
Does not return anything, receives data from the client
remove(ServerSideClientIO) - Method in class main.ClackServer
Does not return anything, takes in a ServerSideClientIO object ‘serverSideClientToRemove’.
removeUser(String) - Method in class main.ClackServer
Removes a user from the userList
run() - Method in class main.ClientSideServerListener
 
run() - Method in class main.ServerSideClientIO
 

S

sendData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Sends data to server, does not return anything
sendData() - Method in class main.ServerSideClientIO
Does not return anything, sends data to the client
ServerSideClientIO - Class in main
The ServerSideClientIO class contains the following variables: closeConnection - boolean representing whether connection is closed or not dataToReceiveFromClient - ClackData object representing data received from the client dataToSendToClient - ClackData object representing data sent to the client inFromClient - ObjectInputStream to receive information from client outToClient - ObjectOutputStream to send information to client server - ClackServer object representing the master server clientSocket - Socket object representing the socket accepted from the client
setDataToSendToClient(ClackData) - Method in class main.ServerSideClientIO
Mutator method to set the ClackData variable dataToSendToClient
setFileName(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Sets the file name in this object
start() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Does not return anything, but starts the connection from the client side
start() - Method in class main.ClackServer
Does not return anything, creates and runs threads wrapped around ServerSideClientIO Runnable objects

W

writeFileContents() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Performs a non-secure file write
Writes the data from the instance variable fileContents to a file called fileName
writeFileContents(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Performs a secure file write
Writes the data from the instance variable fileContents to a file called fileName
